availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Stanfield (Meade County, Kentucky, blacksmith)

body.p: Meade County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Purdy Stanfield in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on March 3, 1848. Father of Eliza Stanfield, Georgeanne Stanfield, and Orla Stanfield. Blacksmith in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Blacksmith in Meade County, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed Kendrick Stanfield as a blacksmith's apprentice in Meade County in 1860. Blacksmith in Meade County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 418B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Meade County, p. 414.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Meade County, KY, 186X, p. 168.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482707, p. 190.
